verses.text: In the third year of the reign of king Belshazzar a vision appeared unto me, \add even unto\add* me Daniel , after that which appeared unto me at the first.

And I saw in a vision ; and it came to pass, when I saw , that I \add was\add* at Shushan \add in\add* the palace , which \add is\add* in the province of Elam ; and I saw in a vision , and I was by the river of Ulai.

Then I lifted up mine eyes , and saw , and, behold, there stood before the river a ram which had \add two\add* horns : and the \add two\add* horns \add were\add* high ; but one \add was\add* higher than the other , and the higher came up last.\f + \fr 8.3 \ft the other: Heb. the second\f*

I saw the ram pushing westward , and northward , and southward ; so that no beasts might stand before him, neither \add was there any\add* that could deliver out of his hand ; but he did according to his will , and became great.

And as I was considering , behold, an he goat came from the west on the face of the whole earth , and touched not the ground : and the goat \add had\add* a notable horn between his eyes.\f + \fr 8.5 \ft touched…: or, none touched him in the earth\f*\f + \fr 8.5 \ft a notable…: Heb. a horn of sight\f*
And he came to the ram that had \add two\add* horns , which I had seen standing before the river , and ran unto him in the fury of his power.

And I saw him come close unto the ram , and he was moved with choler against him, and smote the ram , and brake his two horns : and there was no power in the ram to stand before him, but he cast him down to the ground , and stamped upon him: and there was none that could deliver the ram out of his hand.
Therefore the he goat waxed very great : and when he was strong , the great horn was broken ; and for it came up four notable ones toward the four winds of heaven.
And out of one of them came forth a little horn , which waxed exceeding great , toward the south , and toward the east , and toward the pleasant \add land\add*.

And it waxed great , \add even\add* to the host of heaven ; and it cast down \add some\add* of the host and of the stars to the ground , and stamped upon them.\f + \fr 8.10 \ft to the host: or, against the host\f*

Yea, he magnified \add himself\add* even to the prince of the host , and by him the daily \add sacrifice\add* was taken away , and the place of his sanctuary was cast down.\f + \fr 8.11 \ft to: or, against\f*\f + \fr 8.11 \ft by him: or, from him\f*

And an host was given \add him\add* against the daily \add sacrifice\add* by reason of transgression , and it cast down the truth to the ground ; and it practised , and prospered.\f + \fr 8.12 \ft an host…: or, the host was given over for the transgression against the daily sacrifice\f* \p

¶ Then I heard one saint speaking , and another saint said unto that certain \add saint\add* which spake , How long \add shall be\add* the vision \add concerning\add* the daily \add sacrifice\add*, and the transgression of desolation , to give both the sanctuary and the host to be trodden under foot ?\f + \fr 8.13 \ft that…: or, the numberer of secrets, or, the wonderful numberer: Heb. Palmoni\f*\f + \fr 8.13 \ft of…: or, making desolate\f*
And he said unto me, Unto two thousand and three hundred days ; then shall the sanctuary be cleansed.\f + \fr 8.14 \ft days: Heb. evening morning\f*\f + \fr 8.14 \ft cleansed: Heb. justified\f* \p
¶ And it came to pass, when I, \add even\add* I Daniel , had seen the vision , and sought for the meaning , then, behold, there stood before me as the appearance of a man.
And I heard a man’s voice between \add the banks of\add* Ulai , which called , and said , Gabriel , make this \add man\add* to understand the vision.
So he came near where I stood : and when he came , I was afraid , and fell upon my face : but he said unto me, Understand , O son of man : for at the time of the end \add shall be\add* the vision.
Now as he was speaking with me, I was in a deep sleep on my face toward the ground : but he touched me, and set me upright.\f + \fr 8.18 \ft set…: Heb. made me stand upon my standing\f*
And he said , Behold, I will make thee know what shall be in the last end of the indignation : for at the time appointed the end \add shall be\add*.
The ram which thou sawest having \add two\add* horns \add are\add* the kings of Media and Persia.
And the rough goat \add is\add* the king of Grecia : and the great horn that \add is\add* between his eyes \add is\add* the first king.
Now that being broken , whereas four stood up for it, four kingdoms shall stand up out of the nation , but not in his power.

And in the latter time of their kingdom , when the transgressors are come to the full , a king of fierce countenance , and understanding dark sentences , shall stand up.\f + \fr 8.23 \ft are…: Heb. are accomplished\f*

And his power shall be mighty , but not by his own power : and he shall destroy wonderfully , and shall prosper , and practise , and shall destroy the mighty and the holy people.\f + \fr 8.24 \ft holy…: Heb. people of the holy ones\f*

And through his policy also he shall cause craft to prosper in his hand ; and he shall magnify \add himself\add* in his heart , and by peace shall destroy many : he shall also stand up against the Prince of princes ; but he shall be broken without hand.\f + \fr 8.25 \ft peace: or, prosperity\f*
And the vision of the evening and the morning which was told \add is\add* true : wherefore shut thou up the vision ; for it \add shall be\add* for many days.
And I Daniel fainted , and was sick \add certain\add* days ; afterward I rose up , and did the king’s business ; and I was astonished at the vision , but none understood \add it\add*.
